generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.title: Biome JSON File Biome
generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.description: Contains a format version and a biome definition

fields.title: Format Version
fields.description: Version of the JSON schema used by this file

fields.title: Minecraft Biome
fields.description: A single biome definition

subForm.title: Biome Definition
subForm.description: Contains a description and components to define a Biome.

fields.title: Components
fields.description: Components for this Biome.

subForm.title: Biome Components
subForm.description: Any components that this Biome uses

fields.title: Minecraft Climate
fields.description: Describes temperature, humidity, precipitation, and similar. Biomes without this component will have default values.

subForm.title: Climate
subForm.description: Describes temperature, humidity, precipitation, and similar. Biomes without this component will have default values.

fields.title: Ash
fields.description: Density of ash precipitation visuals

fields.title: Blue Spores
fields.description: Density of blue spore precipitation visuals

fields.title: Downfall
fields.description: Amount that precipitation affects colors and block changes

fields.title: Red Spores
fields.description: Density of blue spore precipitation visuals

fields.title: Snow Accumulation
fields.description: Minimum and maximum snow level, each multiple of 0.125 is another snow layer

fields.title: Temperature
fields.description: Temperature affects a variety of visual and behavioral things, including snow and ice placement, sponge drying, and sky color

fields.title: White Ash
fields.description: Density of white ash precipitation visuals

fields.title: Minecraft Creature Spawn Probability
fields.description: Probability that creatures will spawn within the biome when a chunk is generated.

subForm.title: Creature Spawn Probability
subForm.description: Probability that creatures will spawn within the biome when a chunk is generated.

fields.title: Probability
fields.description: Probabiltity between [0.0, 0.75] of creatures spawning within the biome on chunk generation.

fields.title: Minecraft Humidity
fields.description: Forces a biome to ether always be humid or never humid. Humidity effects the spread chance, and spread rate of fire in the biome

subForm.title: Humidity
subForm.description: Forces a biome to ether always be humid or never humid. Humidity effects the spread chance, and spread rate of fire in the biome

fields.title: Minecraft Mountain Parameters
fields.description: Noise parameters used to drive mountain terrain generation in Overworld.

subForm.title: Mountain Parameters
subForm.description: Noise parameters used to drive mountain terrain generation in Overworld.

fields.title: Steep Material Adjustment
fields.description: Defines surface material for steep slopes

subForm.title: Mountain Parameters - Steep Material Adjustment Settings
subForm.description: Defines surface material for steep slopes

fields.title: East Slopes
fields.description: Enable for east-facing slopes

fields.title: Material
fields.description: Block type use as steep material

fields.title: Name
fields.description: Name of the block

fields.title: States
fields.description: Contains members named after each state, with boolean, integer, or string values.

fields.title: North Slopes
fields.description: Enable for north-facing slopes

fields.title: South Slopes
fields.description: Enable for south-facing slopes

fields.title: West Slopes
fields.description: Enable for west-facing slopes

fields.title: Top Slide
fields.description: Controls the density tapering that happens at the top of the world to prevent terrain from reaching too high

subForm.title: Mountain Parameters - Top Slide Settings
subForm.description: Controls the density tapering that happens at the top of the world to prevent terrain from reaching too high.

fields.title: Enabled
fields.description: If false, top slide will be disabled. If true, other parameters will be taken into account.

fields.title: Minecraft Multinoise Generation Rules
fields.description: Controls how this biome is instantiated (and then potentially modified) during world generation of the nether.

subForm.title: Multinoise Generation Rules
subForm.description: Controls how this biome is instantiated (and then potentially modified) during world generation of the nether.

fields.title: Target Altitude
fields.description: Altitude with which this biome should be generated, relative to other biomes.

fields.title: Target Humidity
fields.description: Humidity with which this biome should be generated, relative to other biomes.

fields.title: Target Temperature
fields.description: Temperature with which this biome should be generated, relative to other biomes.

fields.title: Target Weirdness
fields.description: Weirdness with which this biome should be generated, relative to other biomes.

fields.title: Weight
fields.description: Weight with which this biome should be generated, relative to other biomes.

fields.title: Minecraft Overworld Generation Rules
fields.description: Controls how this biome is instantiated (and then potentially modified) during world generation of the overworld.

subForm.title: Overworld Generation Rules
subForm.description: Controls how this biome is instantiated (and then potentially modified) during world generation of the overworld.

fields.title: Generate For Climates
fields.description: Controls the world generation climate categories that this biome can spawn for. A single biome can be associated with multiple categories with different weightings.

fields.title: Hills Transformation
fields.description: What biome to switch to when converting to a hilly biome

fields.title: Mutate Transformation
fields.description: What biome to switch to when converting to a mutated biome

fields.title: River Transformation
fields.description: What biome to switch to when converting to a river biome (if not the Vanilla 'river' biome)

fields.title: Shore Transformation
fields.description: What biome to switch to when adjacent to an ocean biome

fields.title: Minecraft Overworld Height
fields.description: Noise parameters used to drive terrain height in the Overworld.

subForm.title: Overworld Height
subForm.description: Noise parameters used to drive terrain height in the Overworld.

fields.title: Noise Params
fields.description: First value is depth - more negative means deeper underwater, while more positive means higher. Second value is scale, which affects how much noise changes as it moves from the surface.

fields.title: Noise Type
fields.description: Specifies a preset based on a built-in setting rather than manually using noise_params

fields.title: Minecraft Partially Frozen
fields.description: Component will impact the temperature in a frozen biome, causing some areas to not be frozen. Ex: patchy ice, patchy snow

fields.title: Minecraft Replace Biomes
fields.description: Replaces a specified portion of one or more Minecraft biomes.

subForm.title: Replace Biomes
subForm.description: Replaces a specified portion of one or more Minecraft biomes.

fields.title: Replacements
fields.description: List of biome replacement configurations. Retroactively adding a new replacement to the front of this list will cause the world generation to change. Please add any new replacements to the end of the list.

subForm.title: Biome Replacement
subForm.description: Represents the replacement information used to determine the placement of the overriding biome.

fields.title: Amount
fields.description: Noise value used to determine whether or not the replacement is attempted, similar to a percentage. Must be in the range (0.0, 1.0].

fields.title: Dimension
fields.description: Dimension in which this replacement can happen. Must be 'minecraft:overworld'.

fields.title: Noise Frequency Scale
fields.description: Scaling value used to alter the frequency of replacement attempts. A lower frequency will mean a bigger contiguous biome area that occurs less often. A higher frequency will mean smaller contiguous biome areas that occur more often. Must be in the range (0.0, 100.0].

fields.title: Targets
fields.description: Biomes that are going to be replaced by the overriding biome. Target biomes must not contain namespaces.

fields.title: Minecraft Surface Builder
fields.description: Controls the materials used for terrain generation.

subForm.title: Surface Builder
subForm.description: Controls the materials used for terrain generation.

fields.title: Builder
fields.description: Controls the block types used for terrain generation.

fields.title: Minecraft Surface Material Adjustments
fields.description: Specify fine-detail changes to blocks used in terrain generation (based on a noise function).

subForm.title: Surface Material Adjustments
subForm.description: Specify fine-detail changes to blocks used in terrain generation (based on a noise function).

fields.title: Adjustments
fields.description: All adjustments that match the column's noise values will be applied in the order listed.

subForm.title: Surface Material Adjustments - Surface Adjustment Settings
subForm.description: An adjustment to generated terrain, replacing blocks based on the specified settings.

fields.title: Height Range
fields.description: Defines a range of noise values [min, max] for which this adjustment should be applied.

fields.title: Materials
fields.description: The specific blocks used for this surface adjustment

subForm.title: Surface Material Adjustments - Surface Adjustment Materials Settings
subForm.description: The specific blocks used for this surface adjustment

fields.title: Foundation Material
fields.description: Controls the block type used deep underground in this biome when this adjustment is active.

fields.title: Name
fields.description: Name of the block

fields.title: States
fields.description: Contains members named after each state, with boolean, integer, or string values.

fields.title: Mid Material
fields.description: Controls the block type used in a layer below the surface of this biome when this adjustment is active.

fields.title: Name
fields.description: Name of the block

fields.title: States
fields.description: Contains members named after each state, with boolean, integer, or string values.

fields.title: Sea Floor Material
fields.description: Controls the block type used as a floor for bodies of water in this biome when this adjustment is active.

fields.title: Name
fields.description: Name of the block

fields.title: States
fields.description: Contains members named after each state, with boolean, integer, or string values.

fields.title: Sea Material
fields.description: Controls the block type used in the bodies of water in this biome when this adjustment is active.

fields.title: Name
fields.description: Name of the block

fields.title: States
fields.description: Contains members named after each state, with boolean, integer, or string values.

fields.title: Top Material
fields.description: Controls the block type used for the surface of this biome when this adjustment is active.

fields.title: Name
fields.description: Name of the block

fields.title: States
fields.description: Contains members named after each state, with boolean, integer, or string values.

fields.title: Noise Frequency Scale
fields.description: The scale to multiply by the position when accessing the noise value for the material adjustments.

fields.title: Noise Range
fields.description: Defines a range of noise values [min, max] for which this adjustment should be applied.

fields.title: Minecraft Tags
fields.description:
Attach arbitrary string tags to this biome.
Most biome tags are referenced by JSON settings, but some meanings of tags are directly implemented in the game's code. These tags are listed here:
birch: Biome uses wildflowers (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags). Does nothing if biome is tagged "hills".
cold: Villagers will be dressed for snowy weather.
deep: Pre-Caves and Cliffs, prevents an ocean from having islands or connected rivers and makes the biome less likely to have hills.
desert: Allows partially-buried ruined portals to be placed in the biome. Sand blocks will play ambient sounds when the player is nearby.
extreme_hills: Ruined portals can be placed higher than normal. Biomes tagged "forest" or "forest_generation" will use normal Overworld flowers instead of forest flowers.
flower_forest: Biome uses forest flowers (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags).
forest: Biome uses forest flowers (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags). Does nothing if biome is tagged tagged "taiga" or "extreme_hills".
forest_generation: Equivalent to "forest".
frozen: Villagers will be dressed for snowy weather. Prevents the biome from containing lava springs if it is also tagged "ocean".
ice: Around ruined portals, lava is always replaced by Netherrack and Netherrack cannot be replaced by magma.
ice_plains: Prevents the biome from containing lava springs if it is also tagged "mutated".
jungle: Ruined portals will be very mossy.
hills: Biomes tagged "meadow" or "birch" will use normal Overworld flowers instead of wildflowers.
meadow: Biome uses wildflowers (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags). Does nothing if biome is tagged "hills".
mesa: Sand blocks will play ambient sounds when the player is nearby.
mountain: Ruined portals can be placed higher than normal.
mutated: Pre-Caves and Cliffs, prevents switching to the specified "mutate_transformation" as the biome is already considered mutated. Prevents the biome from containing lava springs if it is also tagged "ice_plains".
no_legacy_worldgen: Prevents biome from using legacy world generation behavior unless the biome is being placed in the Overworld.
ocean: Prevents the biome from containing lava springs if it is also tagged "frozen". Allows ruined portals to be found underwater. Pre-Caves and Cliffs, determines if shorelines and rivers should be placed at the edges of the biome and identifies the biome as a shallow ocean for placing islands, unless the "deep" tag is present.
pale_garden: Biome uses closed-eye blossoms (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags).
plains: Biome uses plains flowers (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags).
rare: Pre-Caves and Cliffs, this tag flags the biome as a special biome. Oceans cannot be special.
swamp: Allows ruined portals to be found underwater. Biome uses swamp flowers (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags).
taiga: Biomes tagged "forest" or "forest_generation" will use normal Overworld flowers instead of forest flowers.

subForm.title: Tags
subForm.description:
Attach arbitrary string tags to this biome.
Most biome tags are referenced by JSON settings, but some meanings of tags are directly implemented in the game's code. These tags are listed here:
birch: Biome uses wildflowers (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags). Does nothing if biome is tagged "hills".

extreme_hills: Ruined portals can be placed higher than normal. Biomes tagged "forest" or "forest_generation" will use normal Overworld flowers instead of forest flowers.
flower_forest: Biome uses forest flowers (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags).
forest: Biome uses forest flowers (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags). Does nothing if biome is tagged tagged "taiga" or "extreme_hills".
forest_generation: Equivalent to "forest".
frozen: Villagers will be dressed for snowy weather. Prevents the biome from containing lava springs if it is also tagged "ocean".

Pre-Caves and Cliffs, determines if shorelines and rivers should be placed at the edges of the biome and identifies the biome as a shallow ocean for placing islands, unless the "deep" tag is present.
pale_garden: Biome uses closed-eye blossoms (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags).

swamp: Allows ruined portals to be found underwater. Biome uses swamp flowers (mutually exclusive with other flower biome tags).
taiga: Biomes tagged "forest" or "forest_generation" will use normal Overworld flowers instead of forest flowers.

fields.title: Tags
fields.description: Array of string tags used by other systems such as entity spawning

fields.title: Description
fields.description: Non-component settings, including the Biome name.

subForm.title: Biome Description
subForm.description: Contains non-component settings for a Biome.

fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The name of the Biome, used by other features like the '/locate biome' command. Identifiers should only be lowercase.
